result.execSummary:
The deferred judgment agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed. The defendant has not been convicted of the dismissed charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan L Statezny

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Megan L Statezny in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:21 am. State is asking for a review date of about 6 months out for stated reasons. Statezny make statement as to why she has not been able to pay in full. Court concerned with the length of the case. Court will extend for 6 months.  Hearing scheduled for April 16, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 12, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Motion hearing on October 18, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Megan L Statezny in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:48 PM. State - here for a motion to revoke Deferred Prosecution Agreement (DPA) and believes the defendant has also filed something. Court corrects State, here for motion hearing to revoke DPA. Court understands that the defendant has $3000.00 to post towards restitution. Stateny agrees and asks for 6 months extension. State has no objections to that. Court will set the matter for a motion hearing in 6 months, will give the check to Victim Witness Coordinator in the amount of $3000.00 that is made payable to the victim and bond is continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 18, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

from def: re deferred entry - JA sends copy to DA
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on April 19, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
To revoke defendant's deferred entry of Judgment and to proceed to sentencing
IN SUPPORT OF REVOKING THE DEFENDANT'S DEFERRED ENTRY OF JUDGMENT
from Attorney Ferguson - no longer represents the defendant

ADDRESS INFO for Megan L Statezny
Current: 222 Maple Street, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 05-31-2016)
Prior: 7976 Main St, Argonne, WI 54511 United States

Defendant Megan L Statezny in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:06 PM. State - here for motion for specific performance and for adjournment of JT that is currently scheduled for 5/11/16. Ferguson states first motion (for specific performance - to pay restitution in full of $12,133.02 and possible dismissal of case/12 month entry of judgment agreement). State responds - disagrees with what has been stated by Ferguson. Ferguson responds. Argument on restitution/agreement/etc. Court attempts to summarzie the issue(s) and recent litigation. State is willing to enter to the original agreement (DEJ) for stated reasons. Ferguson is ready to proceed today with DEJ as well. Court denies motion at this point as the offer is still on the table. Recess at 1:38 PM. Recalled at 2:07 PM with same appearances. Ferguson - willing to proceed to FPT and has provided the Court with a plea questionnaire and deferred entry of judgment. Statezny agrees and pleads G to only count. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, withholds finding of guilt, allows victim(s) to make a statement prior to accepting the DEJ. Victim asks question, Court answers question to the satisfactioon the defendant. Court accepts DEJ for the one year and its conditions, the Clerk is to release the amount posted to the victim and the remainder of the payments are to be made payable to the victim in the form of a cashier's check or money order and deposited with the DA's office for his release to the victim, Court will convert bond to $5000.00 signature with no contact with the victim, Court cannot finds that the amount of restitution submitted by the insurance company is reasonable, pay court appointed attorney fees as originally ordered, adjourned.
Defendant's for specific performance of plea agreement
Motion hearing on April 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Megan L Statezny in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:19 AM. 14CF156 Also called 14CF18 for a motion hearing. Court states update on files. State makes statement regarding restitution on both matters. Ferguson - subject of motion is on 14CF18 - states motion regarding restitution already ordered on this matter. State responds and states his position on the motion - believes the insurance company should be paid restitution. Ferguson responds, states statute. State wants to amend the offer to include an additional $13,000.00 in restitution. Ferguson responds - reliance. Court states frustration. Court - 14CF18 - grants motion of defendant and finds that restitution has been paid in full and will not order reimbursement of the insurance company. Ferguson would like a ruling on the verbal detrimental relieance motion. Court considers that the State has withdrawn the offer and sets the matter for a JT, will consider a motion for detrimental reliance  but not making a ruling on that at this point. State - 3 day JT. Court sets for JT. MIL due 5 days prior to JT and taken up morning of JT if normal MIL and otherwise 30 days prior to JT.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Megan L Statezny in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:20 PM. Discussion in regards to restitution amounts and agreement has not been made. Ferguson makes comment in regards to prior case 14CF18 and possible hearing a motion in that case. Motion to modify can be filed on 14CF18 and court appoints Ferguson specially on that case. Court will allow motion to be heard on 14CF18 and set this case for a plea date. Court advises parties to come to an agreement on these cases as an agreement was to be reached today.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Megan L Statezny in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 5:26 PM. State - off record discussions regarding restitution hearings, victim consultation and adjourning to a later date. Court - just received third amended restitution report on 12/15/16, court will allow reasonable restitution, some adjudication of guilt must be done before restitution can be ordered. Advises State to consult with victim and hold a conference. If not resolved by the 1/20/16 date, will be set for JT.

Defendant Megan L Statezny in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:37 PM. State puts off record discussion on the record, asking for an adjournment for stated reasons (DEJ). Court will allow an adjournment, continues bond, set for another FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Megan L Statezny in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:17 PM. State - here for PTC. Ferguson - updates Court on case. State - case is resolveable and would request another adjournment for stated reasons. Ferguson - agreement is if the defendant pays the restitution in full up front and the charge will be dismissed, asking for 2 week adjournment. State - if money is not posted up front, matter will be deferred entry of judgment. Court prefers it be posted as bond on the case. Ferguson and State have no objections to that. Court sets for FPT. Court increases bond to $5000.00 cash and it will be posted with the COC on 10/22/15  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
from attorney Ferguson to court - regarding replacing counsel Drewa with herself.
on Motion for a County Appointed Expert and Private Investigator

Defendant Megan L Statezny in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:34 PM. Court reviews file (14CF18) to see what motion is regarding - states concerns with restitution being paid to a victim as opposed to an insurance company. State responds. Drewa states he did not represent the defendant in the previous case (Patrick Finlan). Drewa has not spoken to the defendant regarding the first case. State responds - does not believe more restitution should be increased on 14CF18. Court will withhold the release of the request for 10 days (14CF18) and will allow Drewa time to respond to the request and will notify the court if a hearing is needed. If Court does not receive something from Drewa in 10 days, he will sign the amended restitution order but the amount of restitution originally ordered will not change - will not increase it as requested by insurance company. 14CF156 - here for FPT/MH for expert witness fees. Drewa - not resolved and explains. Court will sign the paperwork submitted by Drewa regarding appointing an expert. Drewa states request for expert investigator being appointed. Court will authorize no more than 5 hours for an investigator at no more than $45.00/hr. Drewa to prepare order for Court's signature. Court continues bond and sets for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from OSM requesting adjournment and expert appointed

Defendant Megan L Statezny in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:33 AM. Drewa has information that mirrors complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

Attorney Timothy Drewa in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:39 AM. Drewa - not sure where his client is. State is prepared to proceed and has 3 witnessess subpoenaed, requests forfeiture of any bond posted, bench warrant for her arrest and costs associated with his witnesses. State - informs court how the matter got changed to today's date. Drewa knew about today's date but not sure if defendant knew. Court - bench warrant body or $2000.00. Court will hear any defense arguments for her non-appearance. After further review, the notice may have been sent to the wrong address. State responds, not returned. Court still continues the warrant. Recalled at 11:29 AM. Court provided with waiver of PH form. Court goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Court sets for ARGN on 3/11/15 at 9:30 AM, continues bond.
and certificate of appearance - Officer EB

Waive further reading. Bond continues. Court appt attorney @ $100 p/mo co 3/1/15  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Megan L Statezny in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:03 AM. Statezny has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Statezny understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, cannot afford her own but not eligible for SPD. Given court appointed paperwork in court. State - bond - $5000 signature bond. Court - bond - $5000 signature bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
